text:
Comedian Kiku Sharda, released on bail after being arrested twice for mimicking Dera Sacha Sauda head Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, says the whole experience was “traumatic” and “sad.”

Known for his drag act as Palak in TV show “Comedy Nights With Kapil,” Kiku, 40, was first arrested from Mumbai on Wednesday by Haryana Police after Dera followers registered a case against him in Fatehabad and Kaithal districts on December 31 under Section 295 A (hurting religious sentiments). After getting bail, he was again arrested on the outskirts of Kaithal by Haryana Police.

He termed the action as something that was never expected. “The experience was traumatic and sad. It was quite sudden,” he said.

Kiku asserted that his intention was not to hurt any religious group or anybody.

“When the intention is clear, it is sad the way things had to happen where I had to suddenly go to Haryana and get a bail from the court,” he said.

He said summons was not issued to him. “If I had the summons in my hand, I would have given it to my lawyer. I was informed on Twitter that there is some case filed against me, which I also somehow didn’t take very seriously because I thought maybe someone was trying to scare me on Twitter. So, I didn’t really check. I wish I had,” he said. — PTI
title: Experience traumatic: Kiku
